79c89936-58dc-438c-a62f-97a8fe443ac1.description: iaedp Membership confirms a practitioner's dedication to the highest ethical standards, rigorous training accomplishments, continuing education, and personal growth.
79c89936-58dc-438c-a62f-97a8fe443ac1.name: iaedp Member

issuer.summary: issued by International Association of Eating Disorders Professionals

entity.name: International Association of Eating Disorders Professionals

badge_template_activities.title: iaedp Members complete an application process, providing their professional contact information as well as completing ethical disclosures.

42c56788-4d44-4060-ae83-d60126cadcaf.description: The Certified Eating Disorders Specialist (CEDS) is a licensed therapist or medical provider who has completed high level training and exam assessment in the effective and collaborative treatment of feeding and eating disorders. The CEDS is well versed in medical, nutritional and therapeutic treatment considerations, adheres to a high level of professional ethics, and commits to ongoing expansion of their expertise through specialized continuing education hours.
42c56788-4d44-4060-ae83-d60126cadcaf.name: Certified Eating Disorders Specialist

issuer.summary: issued by International Association of Eating Disorders Professionals

entity.name: International Association of Eating Disorders Professionals

badge_template_activities.title: The CEDS is for a Master’s level therapist or counselor, Doctor of Philosophy (PhD), Doctor of Psychology (PsyD), Doctor of Behavioral Health (DBH), Doctor of Medicine (MD), Doctor of Osteopathic Medicine (DO), Naturopathic Doctor (ND), Physician Assistant (PA), and/or Nurse Practitioner (NP).
Course 1 - Overview of Feeding and Eating Disorders.
Course 2  -Treatment Modalities for Feeding and Eating Disorders.
Course 3 - Nutrition Therapy for Feeding and Eating Disorders.
Course 4 - Medical Treatment of Feeding and Eating Disorders.
The professional has completed over 2500 practice hours treating eating disorders under the guidance of a credentialed eating disorders expert, the iaedp-Approved Supervisor.
Successful completion of a comprehensive, cross-discipline proctored exam demonstrating understanding of therapeutic, nutritional and medical components of eating disorders.
Certified professionals are members of iaedp.
Core courses, membership and testing. Additional expenses include required texts and supervision.
When all requirements are complete, submit the completed application with supporting materials.

0e79e47c-00c3-453d-a293-43fc1ea82c95.description: The iaedp-Approved Supervisor is a CEDS, CEDRD, CEDRN or CEDCAT who has 6000+ hours in the treatment of eating disorders and skills to guide professionals in their process towards independent certification. Those who hold this credential are eligible to provide ongoing consultation for professionals who are in the process of becoming certified and to verify the accrued practice hours of these professionals who are treating feeding and eating disorders.
0e79e47c-00c3-453d-a293-43fc1ea82c95.name: iaedp-Approved Supervisor

issuer.summary: issued by International Association of Eating Disorders Professionals

entity.name: International Association of Eating Disorders Professionals

badge_template_activities.title: The iaedp-Approved Supervisor holds certification as CEDS, CEDRD, CEDRN or CEDCAT.
Complete Leading by Example Workshop and pass test.
The iaedp-Approved Supervisor has >6000 hours in the treatment of eating disorders and skills to guide newer professionalstofullcompetence  treat eating disorders.
Successful completion of knowledge assessment questions based on the Leading by Example course.
iaedp-Approved Supervisors are Certified professionals and are members of iaedp.
There is a fee for the course and application.
Application Form - This main document is one of the required documents to support the final application.
Final Step - Submission portal for fully completed required documents and fee.

099e54ef-c8fa-48df-8083-fe02fb740e5d.description: The Certified Eating Disorders Registered Dietitian (CEDRD) is a Registered Dietitian Nutritionist (RDN) who has completed high level training and exam assessment in the effective and collaborative treatment of feeding and eating disorders. The CEDRD is well versed in medical, nutritional and therapeutic treatment considerations, adheres to a high level of professional ethics, and commits to ongoing expansion of their expertise through specialized continuing education hours.
099e54ef-c8fa-48df-8083-fe02fb740e5d.name: Certified Eating Disorders Registered Dietitian

issuer.summary: issued by International Association of Eating Disorders Professionals

entity.name: International Association of Eating Disorders Professionals

badge_template_activities.title: The CEDRD is for a Dietitian/Nutritionist who is registered through the Commission on Dietetics Registration (RDN)
Course 1 - Overview of Feeding and Eating Disorders.
Course 2  -Treatment Modalities for Feeding and Eating Disorders.

a1f8a6ca-7a47-422a-847f-fa8426d013d8.description: This designation has been created to acknowledge and formally recognize those working in the field of eating disorders or affiliated professions who have completed basic course work (as defined below) with and educational designation. Have knowledge of the mental health issues in Eating disorders.
a1f8a6ca-7a47-422a-847f-fa8426d013d8.name: Associate

issuer.summary: issued by International Association of Eating Disorders Professionals

entity.name: International Association of Eating Disorders Professionals

alignments.name: ASSOCIATE
alignments.description: Associate (also known as the Educational Designation) earners have completed coursework and testing which demonstrates an advanced knowledge of eating disorders, current treatment modalities, medical aspects, and nutritional aspects of diagnosis and treatment which allows them to recognize Eating Disorders.

badge_template_activities.title: Membership with iaedp along with completion of iaedp's 4 Core Courses plus Final Exam

skills.name: Core Knowledge of Eating Disorder Field

69a9c3e1-f43c-4ed8-be37-39be0866164d.description: The Certified Eating Disorders Registered Nurse (CEDRN) is a bachelor's level or higher Registered Nurse (RN) who has completed high level training and exam assessment in the effective and collaborative treatment of feeding and eating disorders.
